alert.note: Alert for Culberson; Jeff Davis; Loving (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 2:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT/430 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Texas and western Texas, including the following counties, in southwest Texas, Culberson, Jeff Davis, Pecos and Reeves. In western Texas, Loving and Ward. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT /430 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 230 PM CDT /130 PM MDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pecos, Kent, Toyah, Mentone, Fort Davis, Balmorhea, Barstow, Saragosa, Balmorhea Lake, Balmorhea State Park, McDonald Observatory, Orla, Davis Mountains State Park, Red Bluff Reservoir, Verhalen, Toyahvale, Pecos Municipal Airport, Toyah Lake, Buffalo Trail Scout Camp and Star Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
